column4: i see helpers asking all the time "did you do an upgrade or fresh install?", is an upgrade not a good option? I have dial-up and downloading an ISO is a two day affair...
my experience is that it depends on how much you've "tweaked" your install. a default install upgrades just fine mostly
ah, that makes sense, was wondering why there would be upgrade if its not recommended
isn't an online upgrade over dial-up just as timeconsuming? I would prefer a one-time download that can be reused
don't know about timing yet, just getting prepared, upgrading to dedicated line next week (high speed not available in my area)
for me; I usually save my settings for apps which I edit the config for a lot and then do a fresh install (leaving my data-partition intact of course)
that's too bad with your connection and all, where're you from?
yep, cell phone is still 2g, copper based tele lines, sat is only hi speed option
wow :/ I live in sweden. Grew up in a town of 10.000 people. got ADSL in like.. 99-00
and now they're installing a MAN in my mothers house
well, its wierd 1/2 mile away is fiber optic cable, but we are on a spur road and no plans by phone company to upgrade for at least 6 months, closest town is 12 miles away
half a mile? Sounds like someone might be able to solder on a cable of his own and draw the fibre along the powerlines :P
i contacted them about running fibe, even volunteered to do the install, they were gonna go for it then said it would cost me $4,000 USD for materials
for materials? how can half a mile of fibre cable and 2 connectors cost that much?
i think i was being blown off actually
yeah sounds like it.. my mom's paying about 3000$ for the install including materials and installation. She has to prepare a cable channel from the road to the house (5 meters)
